body.p: Born on August 19, 1809 in Robertson County, Tennessee. Established the West Tennessean in 1827 in Paris, Henry County, Tennessee. Married Maria Terrell in 1828. Became a Lawyer in 1829 and opened his practice in Dresden, Weakley County, Tennessee. in 1838 he was the editor of The Jacksonian. Elected to the State Senate in 1841 where he served for six years. After the passing of his first wife, Gardner married Agnes H. Cowardin in 1850. In 1852, Gardner organized the Nashville & Northwestern Railroad Company. He was Weakley County's wealthiest planter by the time of the Civil War. Died January 5, 1892 in Gainesville, Cooke County, Texas.
